column4: i have just installed 8.10 but my dell laptop trackpad(mouse) is not working properly. although when i attach an external mouse it acts fine. what should i do ?
i have just installed 8.10 but my dell laptop trackpad(mouse) is not working properly. although when i attach an external mouse it acts fine. what should i do ?
i have just installed 8.10 but my dell laptop trackpad(mouse) is not working properly. although when i attach an external mouse it acts fine. what should i do ?
so that sumone helps us
basically your trackpad drivers didn't install
do a google search specifically for your model and see if there are any linux drivers available for it?
but the trackpad is moving but erratically
oh, well then they're just bad drivers! I can't help you sorry :(
last time when i had the problem i had to just edit the /etx/x11/xorg.conf file and edit the input device part but in 8.10 thr is only "device" section , no "input device" !!!!!
http://paste.ubuntu.com/80411/
thr is a same problem in ubuntu forum but thr r no answers!!
try adding an 'input device' section, do you know what you added last time?
try adding that - if it doesn't work then you might have to wait until someone replies on the forums
i have added that part.but i wanted to make sure before restarting!
it's worth a shot - it should do any serious harm
shouldn't*
you just gave me a heart attack
lol, sorry  - it's late
correct me if im wrong
problem soved
i had done this earlier as well. i had forgotten.
